main event: On May 9, 1950, at Ladd AFB, Alaska, two circular discs, white in color and approximately 60 feet in diameter, were observed hovering motionless for approximately 2 minutes. The objects then accelerated rapidly to the west and disappeared.
interesting points: The objects were observed at a height of approximately 1,000 feet above ground.
The discs were described as white in color and around 60 feet in diameter, indicating their significant size.
They remained motionless for a few minutes before accelerating rapidly, demonstrating sudden and unconventional movement.
The acceleration of the objects was described as 'rapid', indicating a significant increase in speed.
The report was approved and stamped by a Colonel of the USAF, lending it an official and credible status.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
